𒃻𒊒𒌨 𒆗 𒁕𒄉𒈨
šá-ru-ur kal da-ád-me

brilliance of the entire inhabited world!

𒈾𒀊𒄩𒅈 𒅗𒇷 𒋗𒉡 𒁕𒀜𒈪
na-ap-ḫa-ar ka-li šu-nu da-ad-mi

all of the inhabited world

חיה בכל 𓎟 𓏛

total end result finish =>
https://en.m.wiktionary.org/wiki/Reconstruction:Proto-Germanic/dawjaną death töten
https://en.m.wiktionary.org/wiki/Reconstruction:Latin/tuto extinguish

from tōtus “all, whole, entire”, of unknown origin. Perhaps related to Oscan 𐌕𐌏𐌖𐌕𐌏 (touto, “community, city-state”, Umbrian 𐌕𐌏𐌕𐌀𐌌 (totam, “tribe”, acc.), Old English þēod “a nation, people, tribe”, from Proto-Indo-European *tewtéh₂ “people”. More at English Dutch, English thede.

⇔ moribund mortals = man
⇔ totem clan titles

𒂉 ضَرَطَ ḍaraṭa = toot ≈ tout
